column4: I am having difficulty getting my wireless to work right. Everything seemed to be working fine for the first day I had ubuntu running but then yesterday it started dropping the connection and not picking it back up unless I rebooted. Today, it won't work even if I reboot. I have installed a cool little app called wicme to choose waps, but that didn't fix anything. The odd thing is that I can see the access points when I go to configure it, but
I can't connect. It's not a WEP issue b/c it does the same thing with open access points. can someone please give me a couple more ideas? I'm a bit of a newbie but I'm really loving ubuntu!!
My wifi works flawlessly. Perhaps it's a driver issue?
did it get wierd when you installed that client software?
I don't know if it would be helpful, but I use netapplet to manage my network switching.
iwconfig for getting the wifi going
then dhclient
ifconfig is also helpful, as is iwscan
you can man each of those for specifics
ifconfig
do you have an IP?
didn't you just fix this?
no.
nevermind qweqw, he's trolling.
have you tried a different card?
do you have wifi card at your disposal?
I'm wondering if it isn't a driver issue
I had that thought... i couldn't properly set up another card. it just acted really weird.
but I don't really know how to set one up -- lol
are you in linux now?
but it's totally inconsistent
I don't know what I can do to help, but you should join the list-serv, It's really active, and allot of knowlegable people subscribe.
wow. nevermind on the card --- it worked instantly.
yeah, I'll join the list-serv.
